name: PTools Scenario 1
description:
The following Scenario is meant to describe a point in time associated with process flow of the application.  It is meant to be illustrative of the set of FHIR resources to describe the state 


State
Veterans was serviced at ED where a provisional diagnosis of PTSD was recorded. There was a followup appointment with Psych Provider where the initial PTSD was confirmed and an additional diagnosis of Depression was also diagnosed.  The result of the encounter was to have N additional therapy sessions (??) 

Actors
Veteran
Intake(Initial) Provider  - the provider who provided initial diagnosis which triggered the encounter
Encounter Provider - The provider who executed the encounter 


FHIR Resources

Patient(1)
Practitioner(2)
Encounter(1)
Condition(3) provisional and two confirmed
EpisodeOfCare
ServiceRequest
Note?? TBD
TBD CareTeam

value.text: Primary for the Encounter - not the same as the Episode of Care
This is primary diagnosis for PTSD

note.text: This is primary diagnosis for PTSD

meta.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
meta.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

ed.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
ed.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
ed.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
meta.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

ed.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
ed.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.
ed.requirements: Allows identification of the condition as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: The clinical status of the condition.
meta.comment: The data type is CodeableConcept because clinicalStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

ed.short: active | recurrence | relapse | inactive | remission | resolved
ed.definition: The clinical status of the condition.
ed.comment: The data type is CodeableConcept because clinicalStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

ed.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the condition as no longer active.

binding.description: The clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

meta.definition: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.
meta.comment: verificationStatus is not required.  For example, when a patient has abdominal pain in the ED, there is not likely going to be a verification status. The data type is CodeableConcept because verificationStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

ed.short: unconfirmed | provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error
ed.definition: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.
ed.comment: verificationStatus is not required.  For example, when a patient has abdominal pain in the ED, there is not likely going to be a verification status. The data type is CodeableConcept because verificationStatus has some clinical judgment involved, such that there might need to be more specificity than the required FHIR value set allows. For example, a SNOMED coding might allow for additional specificity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

ed.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code refuted and entered-in-error that mark the Condition as not currently valid.

binding.description: The verification status to support or decline the clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

meta.definition: A category assigned to the condition.
meta.comment: The categorization is often highly contextual and may appear poorly differentiated or not very useful in other contexts.

ed.definition: A category assigned to the condition.
ed.comment: The categorization is often highly contextual and may appear poorly differentiated or not very useful in other contexts.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A category assigned to the condition.

mapping.map: 'problem' if from PRB-3. 'diagnosis' if from DG1 segment in PV1 message

meta.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
meta.comment: Coding of the severity with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

ed.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
ed.comment: Coding of the severity with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

mapping.map: Can be pre/post-coordinated into value.  Or ./inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="severity"].value

meta.definition: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

ed.short: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis
ed.definition: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.
ed.requirements: 0..1 to account for primarily narrative only resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identification of the condition or diagnosis.

mapping.map: code 246090004 |Associated finding| (< 404684003 |Clinical finding| MINUS << 420134006 |Propensity to adverse reactions| MINUS  << 473010000 |Hypersensitivity condition| MINUS  << 79899007 |Drug interaction| MINUS << 69449002 |Drug action| MINUS  << 441742003 |Evaluation finding| MINUS  << 307824009 |Administrative status| MINUS  << 385356007 |Tumor stage finding|)  OR < 413350009 |Finding with explicit context| OR < 272379006 |Event|

meta.definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.
meta.comment: Only used if not implicit in code found in Condition.code. If the use case requires attributes from the BodySite resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [bodySite](extension-bodysite.html).  May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

ed.definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.
ed.comment: Only used if not implicit in code found in Condition.code. If the use case requires attributes from the BodySite resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [bodySite](extension-bodysite.html).  May be a summary code, or a reference to a very precise definition of the location, or both.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

meta.definition: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

ed.definition: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.
ed.requirements: Group is typically used for veterinary or public health use cases.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
meta.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. This record indicates the encounter this particular record is associated with.  In the case of a "new" diagnosis reflecting ongoing/revised information about the condition, this might be distinct from the first encounter in which the underlying condition was first "known".

ed.definition: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
ed.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. This record indicates the encounter this particular record is associated with.  In the case of a "new" diagnosis reflecting ongoing/revised information about the condition, this might be distinct from the first encounter in which the underlying condition was first "known".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

a_attr.title: dateTime Age Period Range string Condition.onset[x]18

meta.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.
meta.comment: Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition began to occur.

ed.short: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
ed.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.
ed.comment: Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition began to occur.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

a_attr.title: dateTime Age Period Range string Condition.abatement[x]19

meta.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.
meta.comment: There is no explicit distinction between resolution and remission because in many cases the distinction is not clear. Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition abated.  If there is no abatement element, it is unknown whether the condition has resolved or entered remission; applications and users should generally assume that the condition is still valid.  When abatementString exists, it implies the condition is abated.

ed.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.
ed.comment: There is no explicit distinction between resolution and remission because in many cases the distinction is not clear. Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the Condition abated.  If there is no abatement element, it is unknown whether the condition has resolved or entered remission; applications and users should generally assume that the condition is still valid.  When abatementString exists, it implies the condition is abated.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .effectiveTime.high or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="age at remission"].value or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ]source[classCode=CONC, moodCode=EVN].status=completed

meta.definition: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

ed.definition: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

binding.description: Codes describing the kind of condition staging (e.g. clinical or pathological).

meta.definition: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.
meta.comment: The evidence may be a simple list of coded symptoms/manifestations, or references to observations or formal assessments, or both.

ed.comment: The evidence may be a simple list of coded symptoms/manifestations, or references to observations or formal assessments, or both.

All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes that describe the manifestation or symptoms of a condition.

meta.definition: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

meta.definition: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.
